channel.title: Need help with geometry
channel.description:
The thing is that I don't know how to draw a triangle exactly the same for example to another line with a harp. I don't know how to explain this, but I'll try.
| |\ | | \ | | \ | | \ | | / | | / | | / | | / | |/ The first line is the straight line, then there's the triangle. I don't know how can I replicate the triangle to this straight line so it will be like this /| | / | | / | | / | | \ | | \ | | \ | | \| | with a HARP. I'm not sure that I explained this right, please tell me if you don't understand.

item.title: Need help with geometry
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Ahh, a compass…ok.

So you just want to draw a second congruent triangle reflected over one side? Kinda hard to display in text…lets start with a triangle ABC. Points A and B will be shared between the two triangles and we will have to find the point D, which is the counterpart to C.

 A
 |\
 |  \
 |    \ C
 |    /
 |  /
 |/
 B

Place the spike of the compass on point A and the pencil on point C, then draw a light circle. Next, place the spike on point B and the pencil on point C, and again draw a light circle. You will find the the two circles intersect in two places: at point C (obviously) and also at point D, which is the corresponding side C.

So now, you will have:

    A
   /|\
 /  |  \

D / | \ C
\ | /
\ | /
|/
B

I can’t draw the circles to show you, but I hope that explains it for you

Read full topic
